original: gang du'ang 'gro ba med par sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: gang du'ang 'gro ba med par sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: They teach the Dharma to sentient beings without going anywhere.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag 'jig rten rnams kyi rten yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag 'jig rten rnams kyi rten yin no //
translated: Subhūti, in this way the bodhisattva great beings are a support for the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshul can te /
translated: All phenomena are characterized by emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings do not transgress that character.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dag la ni 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dag la ni 'gro ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, in emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, no going or coming is observed at all.

analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i tshul can te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //

original: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs so; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs so; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, in the unborn, unceasing, unpolluted, and unpurified, no going or coming is apprehended at all.🔽Subh

original: chos thams cad ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / sprul pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / sprul pa'i tshul can te /
translated: All phenomena are like an illusion, a mirage, a dream, a visual aberration, an echo, a reflection of the moon in water, and a magical creation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: And those bodhisattva great beings do not transgress that principle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / sprul pa dag la ni 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / sprul pa dag la ni 'gro ba'am /
translated: And why?

original: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, in an illusion, a mirage, a dream, a visual aberration, an echo, a reflection of the moon in water, and a magical creation, no coming or going is apprehended at all.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni dbri ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni dbri ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med pa'i tshul can te /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are such that they cannot be diminished or increased.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: And those bodhisattva great beings do not transgress that principle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / dbri ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med pa'i tshul can la ni 'gro'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / dbri ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med pa'i tshul can la ni 'gro'am /

analyzed: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, in that which cannot be diminished or increased, no coming or going is apprehended at all.

analyzed: rab @229a *// 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: chos thams cad ni ma 'ongs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma 'ongs pa'i tshul can te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //

analyzed: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because going and coming are not apprehended in the mode of the future at all.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Subhūti, in the same vein,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / blang du med pa dang / dor du med pa la ni 'gro ba'am /

analyzed: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni 'dre ba med pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni 'dre ba med pa'i tshul can te /
translated: all phenomena have the mode of being unadulterated,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings do not transgress that principle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'dre ba med pa la 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / 'dre ba med pa la 'gro ba'am /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'ong ba ci'ang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba ci'ang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because in the absence of contact, no coming or going can be apprehended at all.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'i tshul can te /
translated: “Su­bhūti, all things are characterized by the absence of a self,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: and those bodhisattva great beings do not transgress that principle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / bdag la ni 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / bdag la ni 'gro ba'am /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because in the absence of a self, no coming or going can be apprehended at all.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “Su­bhūti, in the same vein, all things are devoid of sentient beings,

original: chos thams cad ni sems can med pa dang / skye ba po med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gso ba @229b med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / shed las skyes pa med pa dang / shed bu med pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems can med pa dang / skye ba po med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gso ba @229b med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / shed las skyes pa med pa dang / shed bu med pa dang /
translated: are devoid of a life force, are devoid of an individual soul, are devoid of people, are devoid of human beings, and are devoid of human persons.

original: slong ba po med pa dang / kun nas slong ba po med pa dang / byed pa po med pa dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po med pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: slong ba po med pa dang / kun nas slong ba po med pa dang / byed pa po med pa dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po med pa'i tshul can te /
translated: They are not a petitioner, not a motivator, not an agent, not an instigator, not a knower, and not a seer.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings do not transgress that way of being.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / bdag gtan med cing mi dmigs pa dang / de bzhin du sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong pa po dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / bdag gtan med cing mi dmigs pa dang / de bzhin du sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong pa po dang /
translated: Subhūti, it is because a self is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended, and similarly, a being, a living being, a nourished being, an individual, a person, a human, a human being, a petitioner, a motivator,

original: byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: an agent, an instigator, a knower, and a seer are utterly nonexistent and not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos thams cad ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang chos thams cad ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i tshul can no //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, all phenomena have the mode of being permanent and impermanent.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni bde ba'i tshul can dang / sdug bsngal ba'i tshul can dang / bdag gi tshul can dang / bdag med pa'i tshul can dang / stong pa'i tshul can dang / mi stong pa'i tshul can dang /🔽mtshan ma'i tshul can dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul can dang / smon pa'i tshul can dang / smon pa med pa'i tshul can dang / zhi ba'i tshul can dang / dben pa'i tshul can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul can dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni bde ba'i tshul can dang / sdug bsngal ba'i tshul can dang / bdag gi tshul can dang / bdag med pa'i tshul can dang / stong pa'i tshul can dang / mi stong pa'i tshul can dang / mtshan ma'i tshul can dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul can dang / smon pa'i tshul can dang / smon pa med pa'i tshul can dang / zhi ba'i tshul can dang / dben pa'i tshul can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul can dang /
translated: Subhuti, in the same way, all phenomena are the way of happiness, the way of suffering, the way of self, the way of selflessness, the way of emptiness, the way of non-emptiness,🔽the way of signs, the way of signlessness, the way of wishes, the way of wishlessness, the way of peace, the way of isolation, the way of defilement,

original: rnam byang ba'i tshul can dang / skye ba'i tshul can dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul can dang / 'gag pa'i tshul can dang / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul can dang / dngos po'i tshul can dang / dngos po med pa'i @230a *//
analyzed: rnam byang ba'i tshul can dang / skye ba'i tshul can dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul can dang / 'gag pa'i tshul can dang / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul can dang / dngos po'i tshul can dang / dngos po med pa'i @230a *//
translated: the way of purification, the way of production, the way of non-production, the way of cessation, the way of non-cessation, the way of things, the way of non-things,

original: tshul can dang / sdug pa'i tshul can dang / mi sdug pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: tshul can dang / sdug pa'i tshul can dang / mi sdug pa'i tshul can te /
translated: the way of the beautiful, and the way of the ugly.

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not pass beyond that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rab 'byor / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / sdug pa'i bar du gtan med cing mi dmigs te /🔽de'i phyir de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / sdug pa'i bar du gtan med cing mi dmigs te / de'i phyir de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
translated: Subhūti, permanence, happiness, self, and the beautiful up to are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: So how could they have any coming or going?

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni 'dod chags kyi gzhi can dang / zhe sdang gi gzhi can dang / gti mug gi gzhi can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni 'dod chags kyi gzhi can dang / zhe sdang gi gzhi can dang / gti mug gi gzhi can te /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are based on the basis of desire, based on the basis of hatred, and based on the basis of ignorance.

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not pass beyond that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rab 'byor / 'dod chags kyi gzhi dang / zhe sdang gi gzhi dang / gti mug gi gzhi gtan med cing mi dmigs na /🔽de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dod chags kyi gzhi dang / zhe sdang gi gzhi dang / gti mug gi gzhi gtan med cing mi dmigs na / de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
translated: Subhūti, if the basis of desire, the basis of hatred, and the basis of ignorance are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so how could they have any coming or going?

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i gzhi can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i gzhi can te /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are based on the basis of the views.

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not pass beyond that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?🔽

original: rab 'byor / lta ba'i rnam pa'i gzhi gtan med cing mi dmigs na /🔽de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / lta ba'i rnam pa'i gzhi gtan med cing mi dmigs na / de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
translated: If you ask why, Su­bhūti, it is because the basis of the categories of views is absolutely nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How could they have any coming or going?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi tshul can dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul can dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i tshul can dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi tshul can dang / bsam kyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi tshul can dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul can dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i tshul can dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi tshul can dang / bsam kyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi tshul can te /
translated: “Su­bhūti, in the same way, all things are characterized by suchness, characterized by the expanse of reality, characterized by the finality of existence, characterized by sameness, and characterized by the inconceivable expanse.

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: They do not transcend that character.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos mnyam pa nyid dang / @230b bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gtan med cing mi dmigs na /🔽de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos mnyam pa nyid dang / @230b bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gtan med cing mi dmigs na / de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
translated: If you ask why, Su­bhūti, it is because suchness, the expanse of reality, the finality of existence, the sameness of all things, and the inconceivable expanse are absolutely nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How could they have any coming or going?🔽“Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom accordingly should train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom.”

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni g-yo ba med pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni g-yo ba med pa'i tshul can te /
translated: “Subhūti, all phenomena are such that they do not move.

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not transcend that way of being.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / gang 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / gang 'gro ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'ong bar 'gyur ba'i g-yo ba nyid gang yang med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong bar 'gyur ba'i g-yo ba nyid gang yang med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, any movement that would come or go is not found.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi tshul can no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi tshul can no //
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are such that they have the way of being of form.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni tshor ba'i tshul can dang / 'du shes kyi tshul can dang / 'du byed rnams kyi tshul can dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni tshor ba'i tshul can dang / 'du shes kyi tshul can dang / 'du byed rnams kyi tshul can dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshul can te /
translated: Subhūti, similarly, all phenomena are such that they have the way of being of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not transcend that way of being.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: 'ong pa lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //

translated: In the same way, Subhūti, all phenomena have the nature of moral discipline, the nature of patience, the nature of perseverance, the nature of concentration, and the nature of wisdom.

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni nang stong pa nyid kyi tshul can te /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sbyar te /

analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du gtan med cing mi dmigs na / de dag gi 'gro ba'am /

analyzed: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i tshul can no //
translated: “Su­bhūti, all phenomena are the mode of the fruit of entering the stream,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul can te /
translated: and similarly, Su­bhūti, all phenomena are the mode of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment,

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: and they do not pass beyond that mode.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gtan med cing mi dmigs pa dang / de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid med cing mi dmigs na /🔽de dag gi 'gro ba'am /

translated: and similarly, because the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and the state of a pratyekabuddha are nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshul can te /
translated: are the way of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not go beyond that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gtan med cing mi dmigs na /🔽de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gtan med cing mi dmigs na / de dag gi 'gro ba'am /
translated: Subhūti, because unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible,

original: @232a *// 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @232a *// 'ong ba lta ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: how could their going or coming exist?

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not made, not unmade, not stable, not unstable, not diminished, not increased, not gone, not come, then how can the perfection of wisdom be the forerunner of the five perfections, and how can the perfection of wisdom be the basis of the five perfections?🔽

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Reverend Lord!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab mo 'di la su dag mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: Who will have conviction in and aspire to this perfection of wisdom, which is so deep as this?”

original: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sngon bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu spyod pa spyad pa dag dang / sngon gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dag gi drung du tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa dag dang /

translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who have practiced the practice of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in the past, and who have practiced celibacy in the presence of past perfect buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have planted the roots of virtue and are assisted by a spiritual friend will have deep faith in and will aspire to this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid de ci 'dra ba zhig tu 'gyur lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid de ci 'dra ba zhig tu 'gyur lags /
translated: what will be the nature of the minds of those bodhisattva great beings who have deep faith in and aspire to this profound perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi rtags ni ci 'dra ba zhig lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi rtags ni ci 'dra ba zhig lags /
translated: What will be the signs of those bodhisattva great beings?

analyzed: mtshan ma ni ci 'dra ba zhig /
translated: What will be their marks?

original: dbyibs ni ci 'dra ba zhig lags /
analyzed: dbyibs ni ci 'dra ba zhig lags /
translated: What will be their shape?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Transcendent Victor replied, “Śāriputra,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang @232b dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang @232b dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
translated: “Subhūti, the essential nature of the minds of those bodhisattva great beings who have faith in and aspire to this deep perfection of wisdom is the taming of attachment, aversion,

original: gti mug dul ba yin no //
analyzed: gti mug dul ba yin no //
translated: and delusion.”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rtags dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rtags dang /
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who have faith in and aspire to this deep perfection of wisdom will be free from the signs,

analyzed: mtshan ma dang / dbyibs kyi dben pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: characteristics, and shapes of attachment, aversion, and delusion.”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag /
translated: what are the signs,🔽characteristics, and shapes of attachment, aversion, and delusion?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag ji lta bu'i tshul can du 'gyur lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag ji lta bu'i tshul can du 'gyur lags /
translated: What sort of people will they be who will have faith in and aspire to this profound perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ngag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ngag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par yid ches shing mos par 'gyur ba de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: “Su­bhūti, those great bodhisattva beings who will have faith in and aspire to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom will be endowed with omniscience.”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He then said, “Reverend Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'di lta ste /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis pa bsgom pa dag ni /

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul can du 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul can du 'gyur lags so //
translated: will be endowed with omniscience.”

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: “Reverend Lord!🔽Those great bodhisattva beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /
translated: This cultivation of the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams @233a *//
analyzed: chos thams @233a *//
translated: is the destruction of all dharmas.🔽Venerable Transcendent Victor,🔽this destruction of all dharmas

original: cad rnam par 'jig pa lags la /
analyzed: cad rnam par 'jig pa lags la /
translated: is just this cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Blessed One said,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti, this cultivation of the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa'ang /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa'ang /
translated: is the destruction of all dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: ” Subhūti said,🔽“This cultivation of the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa 'di lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa 'di lags so //
translated: is the destruction of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,🔽the destruction of the six inner sense spheres, the six outer sense spheres, and the eighteen elements.🔽Similarly, it is the destruction of the four applications of mindfulness,🔽the four right efforts,🔽the four legs of manifestation,🔽the five faculties,🔽the five powers,🔽the seven branches of enlightenment,🔽and the eightfold noble path.🔽It is the destruction of the three gateways to liberation,🔽the eight aspects of liberation,🔽and the nine serial absorptions.🔽It is the destruction of the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽It is the destruction of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽the ten powers,🔽the four fearlessnesses,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni chos thams cad gang dag rnam par 'jig pa yin /🔽gsol pa / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni chos thams cad gang dag rnam par 'jig pa yin / gsol pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽It is the destruction of the perfection of giving,🔽the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽and the perfection of concentration.🔽It is the destruction of the perfection of wisdom.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of emptiness,🔽the emptiness of great extent,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /
translated: the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽and the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of non-rejection.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of all dharmas.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of non-apprehension.🔽It is the destruction of the emptiness of essential nature.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug dang khams bco brgyad rnam par 'jig pa lags so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug dang khams bco brgyad rnam par 'jig pa lags so //
translated: It is the destruction of the emptiness of non-entities.

original: de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the destruction of the emptiness of essential nature of

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni bdag dang / sems can dang / skye ba po dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni bdag dang / sems can dang / skye ba po dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang /
translated: This cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the disintegration of a self, a sentient being, a living being, a nourishing being, an emancipated one, a human, a human being, a person, an individual, an agent,

original: byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong pa po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po rnam par 'jig pa lags so //🔽de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong pa po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po rnam par 'jig pa lags so // de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: an instigator, one who feels, one who makes others feel, one who knows, and one who sees.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /
translated: It is the same with this cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'jig pa @233b lags so //🔽de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'jig pa @233b lags so // de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /🔽nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid nas /
translated: Similarly, this cultivation of the perfection of wisdom🔽is the disintegration of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par 'jig pa lags so //🔽de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par 'jig pa lags so // de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: and the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽Similarly, this cultivation of the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni /
translated: is the disintegration of the applications of mindfulness,🔽the right efforts,🔽the legs of miraculous power,🔽the five faculties,🔽the five powers,🔽the seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽and the noble eightfold path.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams rnam par 'jig pa lags so //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams rnam par 'jig pa lags so // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the path are being destroyed.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du rnam par 'jig pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du rnam par 'jig pa lags so //
translated: In the same vein, it is because this perfection of wisdom is being taught and explained that🔽the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are being destroyed.

original: de bzhin du 'di lta ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub rnam par 'jig pa lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di lta ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub rnam par 'jig pa lags so //
translated: In the same vein, it is because this perfection of wisdom is being taught and explained that the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are being destroyed.🔽In the same vein, it is because this perfection of wisdom is being taught and explained that the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening are being destroyed.

original: de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same vein, it is because this perfection of wisdom is being taught and explained that the knowledge of all aspects is being destroyed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnam par 'jig pa lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnam par 'jig pa lags so //
translated: This cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the destruction of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod @235a *//🔽pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod @235a *// pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “Subhūti, in this deep perfection of wisdom, the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpas nye bar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpas nye bar brtag par bya ste /
translated: the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom, and similarly, connect this with each, up to the knowledge of all aspects should be investigated by the irreversible bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: “There are some bodhisattva great beings who do not settle down on this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, they do not settle down on the perfection of concentration, perfection of perseverance, perfection of patience, perfection of morality, or perfection of giving.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: they do not settle down on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni /
translated: “There are some bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa na /
translated: who, when practicing this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: gzhan gyis smras pa'i tshig dag la snying po med pa dang / de kho na ma yin par khong du chud bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa'i tshig dag la snying po med pa dang / de kho na ma yin par khong du chud bar byed de /
translated: understand the words spoken by others to be without essence and not the way things are.

original: gzhan gyi dad pas mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dad pas mi 'gro'o //
translated: One does not go by the faith of others.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i nye bar nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i nye bar nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One is not carried away by the mental afflictions of desire, anger, and ignorance, or by the mental afflictions that arise from the mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni /
translated: Some bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang @235b bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang @235b bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: who practice this profound perfection of wisdom are not separated from the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not separated from the perfection of ethical discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid thos nas mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid thos nas mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: “There are some bodhisattva great beings who, when practicing this profound perfection of wisdom, do not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified when they hear this very profound perfection of wisdom.

original: mi zhum mi 'gong ste /
analyzed: mi zhum mi 'gong ste /
translated: They do not become timid or cowed, and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur la /
translated: their minds do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo nyan par mngon par dga' zhing /🔽thos nas kyang 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo nyan par mngon par dga' zhing / thos nas kyang 'dzin par byed /
translated: They delight in listening to the profound perfection of wisdom,

original: 'chang bar byed /🔽kun chub par byed pa nas /
analyzed: 'chang bar byed / kun chub par byed pa nas /
translated: and having heard it, they take it up.🔽They bear it in mind,🔽master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i bar du byed pa dang / de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i bar du byed pa dang / de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa na /
translated: and practice it properly.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: “You should know that those bodhisattva great beings are irreversible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos shing yongs su dri ba byas pa dang / bzung ba dang / kun chub par byas pa nas tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i bar du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos shing yongs su dri ba byas pa dang / bzung ba dang / kun chub par byas pa nas tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i bar du byas pa yin no //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being has previously heard this deep perfection of wisdom, asked questions about it, taken it up, understood it, and properly paid attention to it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'chad pa na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'chad pa na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because when this deep perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: that bodhisattva great being is not afraid, is not terrified, and does not get scared;

original: mi zhum mi @236a *//
analyzed: mi zhum mi @236a *//
translated: is not cowed, does not tense up,

original: 'gong ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las de'i yid phyir ldog bar mi 'gyur ba'i steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: 'gong ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las de'i yid phyir ldog bar mi 'gyur ba'i steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin par byed /
translated: and does not turn back in the face of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and on top of that takes up this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: 'chang bar byed /
analyzed: 'chang bar byed /
translated: carries it,

original: kun chub par byed pa nas tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i bar du byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'chad pa na mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur la /🔽mi zhum mi 'gong ste /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las kyang yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin par bgyid pa nas /🔽tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa'i bar du bgyid pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des /
analyzed: kun chub par byed pa nas tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i bar du byed pa'i phyir ro // de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to // btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'chad pa na mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur la / mi zhum mi 'gong ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las kyang yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin par bgyid pa nas / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa'i bar du bgyid pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des /
translated: because they will make it their own, and will practice it properly in mind.🔽🔽Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:🔽“Lord,🔽those bodhisattva great beings who, when this deep perfection of wisdom is being taught, do not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified,🔽do not become cowed or stolid,🔽and do not turn away from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and on top of that take up this deep perfection of wisdom,🔽and practice it properly in mind, those bodhisattva great beings,🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la ji ltar spyad par bgyi lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la ji ltar spyad par bgyi lags /

will make it into a book

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis spyad par bya'o //
translated: “You should practice with a mental continuum that is directed toward the knowledge of all aspects.🔽”🔽Subhūti asked,

original: gsol pa / ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis spyad par bgyi lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis spyad par bgyi lags /
translated: “How should one practice with a mental continuum that is directed toward the knowledge of all aspects?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: stong pa nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / de bzhin du @236b mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / de bzhin du @236b mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis spyad par bya'o //
translated: “You should practice with a mental continuum that is directed toward emptiness, and similarly with a mental continuum that is directed toward signlessness and directionlessness.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Similarly, you should practice with a mental continuum that is directed toward space, and similarly, you should connect this with each,

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / de bzhin du de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / de bzhin du de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang /
translated: with a mental continuum that is directed toward nonproduction, nonstopping, nondefilement, and nonpurification, and similarly with a mental continuum that is directed toward suchness,

original: de bzhin du de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba dang / chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la gzhol ba dang / chos mnyam pa nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba dang / chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la gzhol ba dang / chos mnyam pa nyid la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang /
translated: Likewise, it is the mental continuum that is directed toward suchness, directed toward the dharma-constituent, directed toward the reality limit, and directed toward the sameness of all things; it is the mental continuum that is directed toward the inconceivable expanse;

original: de bzhin du sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / sprul pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyad par bya'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / sprul pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyad par bya'o // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and likewise, it is the mental continuum that is directed toward illusions, mirages, reflections of the moon in water, dreams, optical aberrations, echoes, and magical incarnations.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la bzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la bzhol ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practice this deep perfection of wisdom with a mind-stream that is set on emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / sprul pa la gzhol pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @237a *//
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / sprul pa la gzhol pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @237a *//
translated: and similarly, connect this with each, practice this deep perfection of wisdom with a mind-stream that is set on an illusion, a mirage, a reflection of the moon in water, a dream, an optical aberration, an echo, and a magical creation,

original: 'di la spyod na /
analyzed: 'di la spyod na /
translated: then,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: venerable Lord,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de gzugs la spyod pa lags sam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de gzugs la spyod pa lags sam /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings practice that in form,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyod pa lags sam /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyod pa lags sam /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: or do they practice that in feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa lags sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa lags sam /
translated: up to and practice the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa ni gzugs la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa ni gzugs la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom do not practice form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: do not practice feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sbyar te / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo /
translated: and similarly, Subhūti, connect this with each,

original: 'di la spyod pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la spyod pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: up to bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom do not practice the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de ni sus kyang ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de ni sus kyang ma byas /
translated: “Subhūti, that knowledge of all aspects is not made by anyone,

original: 'gyur bar yang ma byas /🔽gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /🔽gang du'ang ma song /
analyzed: 'gyur bar yang ma byas / gang nas kyang ma 'ongs / gang du'ang ma song /
translated: is not changed,🔽does not come from anywhere,

original: gang la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: gang la'ang mi gnas /
translated: does not go anywhere,🔽and does not stand anywhere.

original: yul na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: yul na'ang mi gnas /
translated: It does not dwell in a place,

original: phyogs na'ang mi gnas te /
analyzed: phyogs na'ang mi gnas te /
translated: nor does it dwell in a direction.

original: de la ni grangs dang / rtsis kyang mi gnas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de la ni grangs dang / rtsis kyang mi gnas mi dmigs so //
translated: In it, counting and reckoning do not dwell and are not found.

original: gang la grangs dang / rtsis mi dmigs pa de ni sus kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gang la grangs dang / rtsis mi dmigs pa de ni sus kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
translated: That in which counting and reckoning are not found cannot be fully awakened to by anyone.🔽It cannot be fully awakened to by form,

original: gzugs sam / tshor ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs sam / tshor ba'am /
translated: feeling,

original: 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'du shes sam /
translated: perception,

original: 'du byed rnams sam /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sam /
translated: volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes @237b pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes @237b pa'am /
translated: or consciousness.🔽It cannot be fully awakened to by generosity,

original: sbyin pa'am / tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'am / tshul khrims sam /
translated: moral discipline,🔽patience,

original: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
translated: diligence,

original: bsam gtan dag gam /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag gam /
translated: meditative concentration,

original: shes rab bam /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: shes rab bam / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: or wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar gyis kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar gyis kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: In the same way, it cannot be fully awakened to by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin la /
translated: Form itself is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / de bzhin du 'du shes dang / de bzhin du 'du byed rnams dang / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / de bzhin du 'du shes dang / de bzhin du 'du byed rnams dang / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, it is because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness itself is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni gcig pa nyid yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni gcig pa nyid yin /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because the suchness of physical forms and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are the same suchness.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni gcig pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni gcig pa nyid yin /
translated: Similarly, the suchness of feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are the same suchness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein, as before,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni gcig pa nyid yin /🔽de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid @238a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni gcig pa nyid yin / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa'i de bzhin nyid @238a *//
translated: The suchness of the perfection of giving up to the suchness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects up to the suchness of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.

original: de ni gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
analyzed: de ni gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
translated: Because the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects and the suchness of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.

original: bsgom pa'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: bsgom pa'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu gnyis pa'o ////
translated: This was the twenty-second chapter, “Cultivation,” in the perfection of wisdom

original: de nas 'dod pa ni spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha dag gis lha'i tsandan gyi phye ma dag kyang /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa ni spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha dag gis lha'i tsandan gyi phye ma dag kyang /
translated: Then the gods of the desire realm and the gods of the form realm scattered divine sandalwood powder

original: rgya spos dang / ta la'i lo ma'i phye ma dag dang / lha'i autpal dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar po dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gtor nas /
analyzed: rgya spos dang / ta la'i lo ma'i phye ma dag dang / lha'i autpal dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar po dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gtor nas /
translated: and with powders of sandalwood, and with powders of tāla leaves, and with divine blue lotuses, and with lotuses, and with white lotuses, and with water lilies, they scattered them over the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs  la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs  la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Then they approached the Blessed One, and having approached and prostrated themselves at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: they sat down to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas kyang lha de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas kyang lha de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: And having sat down to one side, those gods said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: Form itself is the knowledge of all modes.
